1.question: The movie offended many of the parents of its younger viewers by including unnecessary ______ in the dialogue.?

2.question: His neighbors found his ______ manner bossy and irritating, and they stopped inviting him to backyard barbeques.

3.question: Steven is always ______ about showing up for work because he feels that tardiness is a sign of irresponsibility

4.question: Levina unknowingly ______ the thief by holding open the elevator doors and ensuring his escape.

5.question: Candace would ______ her little sister into an argument by teasing her and calling her names.

6.question: The dress Ariel wore ______ with small, glassy beads, creating a shimmering effect

7.question: Being able to afford this luxury car will ______ getting a betterpaying job.

8.question: Shakespeare, a(n) ______ writer, entertained audiences by writing many tragic and comic plays

9.question: I had the ______ experience of sitting next to an over-talkative passenger on my flight home from Brussels.

10.question: Prince Phillip had to choose: marry the woman he loved and ______ his right to the throne, or marry Lady Fiona and inherit the crown.

11.question: If you will not do your work of your own ______, I have no choice but to penalize you if it is not done on time

12.question: Giulia soon discovered the source of the ______ smell in the room: a week-old tuna sandwich that one of the children had hidden in the closet.

13.question: After making ______ remarks to the President, the reporter was not invited to return to the White House pressroom.

14.question: With her ______ eyesight, Krystyna spotted a trio of deer on the hillside and she reduced the speed of her car.

15.question: With a(n) ______ grin, the boy quickly slipped the candy into his pocket without his mother’s knowledge.

16.question: Her ______ display of tears at work did not impress her new boss, who felt she should try to control her emotions.

17.question: Johan argued, “If you know about a crime but don’t report it, you are ______ in that crime because you allowed it to happen.”

18.question: The authorities, fearing a ______ of their power, called for a military state in the hopes of restoring order.

19.question: The story’s bitter antagonist felt such great ______ for all of the other characters that as a result, his life was very lonely and he died alone.

20.question: It is difficult to believe that charging 20% on an outstanding credit card balance isn’t ______!
